DSM-5 Criteria Evidence of ADHD - Summary Current Episode
DSM-5 Criteria Evidence of ADHD -Summary Most Severe Past
Predominantly Inattentive Presentation - Summary Current Episode: Meets criterion for Inattention, but not criterion for Hyperactivity/Impulsivity for at least 6 months.
Predominantly Inattentive Presentation - Summary Most Severe Past: Meets criterion for inattention, but not criterion for Hyperactivity/Impulsivity for at least 6 months.
Predominantly Hyperactive/Impulsive Presentation - Summary Current Episode: Meets criterion for Hyperactivity/Impulsivity, but not criterion for Inattention for at least 6 months
Predominantly Hyperactive/Impulsive Presentation -Summary Most Severe Past: Meets criterion for Hyperactivity/Impulsivity, but not criterion for Inattention for at least 6 months.
Combined Type - Summary Current Episode: Meets criterion for both Inattention and Hyperactivity/Impulsivity for at least 6 months.
Combined Type -Summary Most Severe Past: Meets criterion for both Inattention and Hyperactivity/Impulsivity for at least 6 months.
Difficulty following Instructions: Child - Current
Other Specific Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder -Summary Current Episode: Prominent symptoms of Inattention or Hyperactivity/Impulsivity that do not meet criteria for attention.
Other Specific Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder -Summary Most Severe Past: Prominent symptoms of Inattention or Hyperactivity/Impulsivity that do not meet criteria for attention.
